name: estrangement
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C or U ] a period when you are estranged from someone (= no longer friendly with them), or the fact of no longer being friendly: Their reunion followed a long estrangement. He talked about his estrangement from his family.
[ U ] a feeling that you do not understand someone or something, or do not have any connection with him, her, or it: College athletes share a feeling of estrangement from the other students. See
estranged
More examplesFewer examplesOver time, estrangements have a serious emotional impact.They reunited after a two-year estrangement.Reaching a trade agreement is a tough prospect in light of the two nations' long-standing estrangement.Many people feel a sense of estrangement from both main political parties.
